name: hugger
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
someone who likes to express affection for someone (= liking them) in a physical way by hugging (= holding them close to your body with your arms): I'm not a hugger, but I was so happy I grabbed him and lifted him off the ground. These people are huggers. They show more emotion than any other group of men I've ever met. See also
hiphuggers
tree hugger
More examplesFewer examplesI gave him a strong handshake but I'm not a hugger.He's a toucher, a hugger and kisser, constantly touching you on the arm or patting you on the shoulder.I hope you don't mind but I'm a hugger.I find that people from the southern states are great huggers.
